Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Tombstone with Coptic Inscriptions
Description: A slab of marble that was used as a tombstone, it is inscribed with six lines of Coptic script. At the top there is a cross, the name of the deceased, and some supplications. The tombstone formed a link between the deceased and the world he or she had left behind. Several hundred pieces like this have been discovered, inscribed either in Coptic or in Greek.
